text: Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is really tropical. Mango, passionfruit and some pineapple. Flavour is very fruity again, moderate bitterness with a soft body.

Can given as a birthday present from Richthevillan. Cheers Rich. Cloudy soup like orange yellow beer with medium head. Aroma of citrus, pineapple and resin. Taste is citrus, pine resin, grapefruit, tangerine, malts and stewed fruit with some warming booze. Chewy body. Excellent.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text:
Can at the Matteo Farwell Tasting, 20/02/17.
Hazed orange with a decent off white cap.
Nose is dank hop, pissy tropical pulp, mango, grapefruit zest.
Taste comprises cantaloupe melon, pine, mango, grapefruit, tangerine, light white peppery spice, dank hop strokes.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with semi dank hop bitterness.
Solid DIPA but this one didnt quite stand up against the regular DIPA series for me.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Can thanks to Blue_Zulu! Pours turbid peachy orange with a modest white head which soon recedes. Full on aroma of peaches, mangoes and grapefruit. Taste is peachy sweet, tropical fruit sweet, mango sweet with a balance of pine bitterness. Wish Id had this fresher but its still in good form.

Keg at The Bottle Shop, Bermonsdey, London, UK. Many thanks to Matteo to have introduced me to this world in my first week in London. When we ordered I didn’t understand if he ordered a beer or a juice. Colour is dense, murky orange with a small foamy white head. Aroma is an explosion of fruity hops. Tropical fruits, mango, peach, papaya, marmalade, melon. Taste is medium to strong sweetness and low to medium bitterness. Really intense. Full bodied, fine carbonation, texture is sticky, oily, like a juice. Finish is very very long, spices, fruity and bitter. Was my first DIPA in London and.. What a DIPA!
440ml Can - Murky golden/light orange. Grapefruit, pineapple and peach in the aroma. Tropical and hoppy taste with grapefruit, passion fruit and pineapple. Very easy to drink.

500ml can. Pours murky, muddy, opaque orange, medium white head. Aroma of exotic fruits, passionfruit. Taste is super smooth with mushy mango, passionfruit, peach with a confident pineapple / grapefruit bitterness. Enjoyable but a bit messy and needs a little more clarity of flavours.

From can at Dangerous Bottleshares Dåsebajer and shelfie edition thanks to Bursprak. Pours a suuuuper milky, yeasty, murky, swampy yellowish brown with a medium sized, white head. Aroma has super leafy hops, pretty acidic citrus, honey dew, fruits, sweet stone fruits. Taste is sweet, sticky mango and a honey dew, super fruity, leafy bitter hops. Full body and an average carbonation. #hopburp

Pours totally unclear yellow with a white head. Aroma of mellow sweet citrus fruits, ripe orange, tropical notes, stone fruits, dank and slight lactose. Taste of sweet citrus, dank hops, ripe orange, stone fruits and a tropical feel to it. Lots and lots of hops in this and a somewhat sweet outcome. Still the 9 % gives this a sharp edge but despite that it is extremely drinkable!
From can. Pours super murky soupy yellowish with a small head. Super juicy with passionfruit, oranges, banana, mangoes, papaya, dankness, light estery and some light sweetness. Gewd!

20th February 2017Matteos Ciao @ Craft Islington. Thanks to the team for the can. Cloudy gold beer, tidy pale cream colour head. Smooth airy dry palate, decent fine carbonation. Light dry sweetish malts. Nibbly hop spice that builds in strength. Chalky minerals. More hop spice. Mellow tropical fruits. Little orange and lemon. Tangy bitterness. Some orange peel on the finish. Bitter linger with that strong hop spice almost burning. Seeing the scores for this one I was anticipating this one hugely, but it never reached the stratosphere. Its a very good DIPA but no wow factor for me. Strange!
Keg at the free trade inn., massive soup murk... No head.. Soft sweet floral orange peach pinnapple nose... Light fizz.. Dry fruits.. Light zezty... Big peacj and pinnapple.. Dusty fruit... Best

From can thanks to bursprak my man :) Thanks buddy. Pours thick juicy light milky orange. Pineapple fuckin haze. Smells like tropical haze. Literally. Huge pineapple, tangerine, mango fuckin dankness. Holy shit. Taste follows. Dank, tropical, lots of pineapple, mango, tangerine, passion fruit and a grassy bitter finish. Wow!
Huge hop, haze bomb. Incredible Aroma of tropical fruits. I can see why people love this but for me the lingering, almost unbalancing bitterness took this away from a top class double IPA for me.

My 4K. Tropical fruits, unripe mango, passion fruit, tangerine. Super hazy, almost milky gold, small, creamy, off-white head. Light bitter. More pine, grass, bitterness intensifying, soft carbonation, full bodied, a touch harsh in the finish. Very nice IIPA, fantastic aroma, would even say more intense and better than v12 but not quite balanced in taste and palate. Keg at The Bottle Shop, Bermondsey.

February 2017 - Bottle share at CBC Islington for the Matteo Farewell tasting as Cloudwater Birthday DIPA. Huge thanks to Matteo for sourcing this insta-whale! Pours a dirty matte orange, hazy and opaque, foamy off-white head, full lacing. Aroma is quite light, some peach, dank and oniony. A bit muted. Body is smooth with soft carbonation. Taste has light peach, straw, rubbery, floral hops, some petrol vibes, touch more bitterness than you often get in NE IPAs. I like it a lot. Maybe theres some variability - took my time with it but couldnt get the fireworks other have. Still, its great. (4.0)

Tasted on Keg, 21-02-2017. 

Appearance was hazy, murky orange- gold with a small, lingering head of medium- large bubbles.
Aroma was full of dank, juicy citra with peach, nectarines, very ripe mango.
Taste matched the aroma with a touch of pineapple to finish.
Palate was thick, chewy mouthfeel. Very luscious.
Finish was slightly boozy, but lingering, full with ripe stone fruits and slight tropical flavours.

Can from The Beerhive. Murky butterscotch body with a thin white head that fades. Steady carbonation. No lacing. Aroma of pineapple, spring onion, nectarine, mango and pine. Flavour of nettles, sweet melon, green banana, peppery hops and a bitter finish. Medium body with a smooth texture. Soft fizz. Very hoppy and bitter. The tingly, spicy finish lasts for ages.

Can at Matteo caio tasting Craft Islington. Hazy cloudy gold lasting white head. Dank hop but some fruit too. Aroma is good. Lots and lots of hops. Just way too much for me. Too much hop but better than the dipa 12. More fruit comes through. Tannin. Like chewing hop flowers. Hmmmm.

Can share at Matteos farewell event. Pours hazy golden with a good head that fades. Aroma is tropical fruits, dank and a little pepper. Taste is really juicy tropical fruits. Very little booze. Really nice.

Pours a thick, soupy orange with a thin white head. This is the most tropical fruit smelling beer Ive ever come across, it just smells so juicy of pineapple and mango with papaya. My god! Theyve done it! Theyve made a lovely juicy beer with amazing bitterness!!! This is the best DIPA Ive had.

Keg at Cotteridge Wines tasting room; murky golden yellow pour with a bubbly off white head, aroma has big juicy resinous pine and mango pulp, taste has loads of tropical hop action, oily pine, dank undertones, decent IBUs, pine needles, melon undercurrent, tangerine, some pineapple.

440ml can from Eebria, canned just 4 days ago. Pours a murky yellow orange colour with a small white head, poor retention so it looks like fruit juice. Aroma full of juicy tropical fruits. Likewise the taste is super juicy, tropical fruit, citrus, grassy, dank hops, moderate sweetness leading into a pleasant bitterness, alcohol well hidden. Medium bodied, mouthfeel is smooth, average carbonation. I think this is it; this is the best DIPA theyve made so far, theres really not much to improve on here. Love it. Happy birthday Cloudwater!

Keg at Salt Horse. Pours... like mixture of piss and puke. Nose is juicy fruity, grassy hoppy, citrus, mango. Tastes juicy mango, tropical fruits, light booze, crispy carbonation. Quite good, big beer if little harsh.

Keg at the Bottle Shop - London. Pours murky gold with a frothy, white head. Intense aroma, hugely layered with hop characteristics, lots of dank weedy notes, juicy citrus, tangerine, ripe mango, melon. Medium to big sweet flavour with pale bread ballast, mild piney bitterness, some grass, orange rind, more mango, papaya. Medium to full bodied with fine to average carbonation. Warming finish, heartily resinous, with assertive and lingering grassy bitterness, more rich and dank hops, orange rind, more melon and papaya. Huge stuff. Quite well rounded. The bitterness is higher than with other Cloudwater DIPAs, which I imagine some folks would like. Overall, its superlative stuff.

Keg at the bottle shop druid Street. Aroma is earth sgarteringly good, lots of danky grassy hops, mixed with big juicy goodness, mango, pollen and pine. Loads of layered hops. A murky golden orange coloured pour with a fine sticky white head. Flavour is composed of raw wheaty grains oats, assertive pine and dank citrus hop, background juicy mango, petrol. Hides the alcohol pretty well. . Big assertive hop bitterness. Palate is medium sticky, highish Massaging carbonation and a dry crisp finish. So fucking good.

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2017 Keg at Bottle Shop. It pours crazy murky creamy golden with a decent white head. The aroma is insane...rich, sweet, juicy, creamy, crazy dank, weed, grass, light onion, mango, papaya, passion fruit, orange creamsicle, candied peel, brioche and bread & marmalade. The taste is fresh, juicy, some bitterness (more than their usual DIPAs) freshly cut grass, dank, weed, pine needles, dull herbal, peppery spice, orange peel, tangerine, pomello, lemon parfait, easy peel, mango, persimmon, bread, light alcohol warmth and a touch of peppery spice through the finish. Medium body and moderate, foamy carbonation. Glorious stuff. Perhaps their best DIPA??! Exceptional. Upped to 4.6 from 4.5 on re-rate. Shit the bed.

Pours extremely cloudy, soupy even, whitish tone of gold. Minimal head. Looks wise, it looks like a beer thats gone off but I know its supposed to look like this. Aromas of hops, hops and hops. Pine dominant but also a good hint of tropical fruit and some citrus. Good carbonation and mouth feel. Taste is massive with lots of tropical fruit and citrus, and some vermont yeast. Finish is dry, bitter, citrus and pine with a boozy edge

Can, picked up at the brewery. Canned 3 days ago. Soupy, dark yellow gold. Film of lasting, white head. Some legs. Nose has scorched citrus. Apricot jam. Lots of vanilla infused brioche. Punchy grapefruit and sweet peach. Some notes of pine resin and fresh sawn wood. Taste is chewy and resinous, gluey bitter. Lots of sticky sweetness. Chewy mouthfeel. Slick and oily. Punchy, chewy bitter finish. Very decent, but comes across a bit unfinished, maybe.

44cl can via Eebria. It pours a completely murky apricot juice color with a minimal white head. Aroma is pure hops juice. Massive tropical fruit salad notes and dank, weed, melon. Massive. Taste is also all the same with medium sweetness and tiny bitterness and a long tropical fruit finish. Really intense. No trace of booze. Huge mango apricot persimmon and danky weed notes. Medium to full bodied with full carbonation and silky mouthfeel. Overall, easily in the top 3 IPA cathegory for me
Hazy, Golden, Dank, Tropical aromas and flavours. Smooth and absolutely delicious. Happy birthday Cloudwater!
Can at the hanging bat. Pours deep yellow orange, nose is mango, citrus, taste is juicy fruit, sweet, dry, bitter.
